text: In this section, we walk through how each complaint is investigated and resolved in a structured, transparent way.
Once a complaint is reflected in the IO portal, it appears under unprocessed.
The investigation officer reviews the details and activates the case by marking it in process.
This step starts the formal investigation and triggers system based timeline tracking.
The next step is root cause analysis.
The investigation officer examines the complaint, reviews evidence, conducts worker interviews and cross checks records such as attendance, payroll or security records where needed.
Based on this review, the RCA section is filled as valid, partially valid or invalid cases with clear justification.
A deadline is entered for associated corrective and preventive actions.
For valid or partially valid cases, a corrective and preventive action plan is developed.
This includes immediate corrective steps to resolve the issue and preventive measures to stop it from happening again.
Responsibilities and deadlines are assigned and the system automatically tracks progress and sends reminders.
Once actions are implemented, the investigation officer uploads supporting evidence such as photos, records, statements or policy updates.
All evidence is securely stored and timestamped, creating a complete and compliant documentation trail.
The case is then submitted to FOS for complainant interview.
For complex cases, the system also allows complaints to be routed directly to relevant internal teams via email.
This enables coordination and quicker decision making across departments.
Once a complaint is submitted, EFOS team contacts back the complainant directly for verification.
We explain the actions taken and confirm if the worker is satisfied with the outcome.
This independent check ensures fairness and builds trust.
If the worker is not satisfied, the case is bounced back to the investigation officer.
For the investigation officer must update the rca, revise the CAPA and resubmit with improved documentation.
This prevents premature or incomplete closures.
The system also supports escalation if timelines are missed or cases are repeatedly bounced back.
Senior management can be automatically engaged to ensure accountability.
When the worker confirms satisfaction, FOS officially closes the complaint and records closure feedback.
These insights help factories understand recurring issues and strengthen long term risk prevention.
